description: The root cause of the issue related to LSASS memory leaks on domain controllers is due to a problem with Kerberos requests that affect the Windows Server platforms. Specifically, the memory leak occurs in Windows Server 2022, Windows Server 2016, and Windows Server 2012 R2, as confirmed by several KB articles including KB-5037426, KB-5037423, KB-5037422, KB-5035885, and KB-5035857. This leak can lead to performance degradation and service disruptions if not addressed. The originating message ID provides critical context for tracking this memory leak issue across deployments. Resolving this underlying issue requires applying the patches detailed in the associated KB articles.
